db:abstract.db:para: The Qt Positioning API provides positioning information via QML and C++ interfaces.

db:article.db:para: The Qt Positioning API provides positioning information via QML and C++ interfaces.
Currently, the API is supported on Android, iOS, macOS, Linux, and Windows (with GPS receivers exposed as a serial port providing NMEA sentences or using Windows.Devices.Geolocation).

db:section.db:title: Overview
db:section.db:para: The Qt Positioning API lets you to determine a position by using a variety of possible sources, including satellite, wifi, or text files. That information can then be used to, for example, determine a position on a map. In addition, you can use to the API to retrieve satellite information and perform area based monitoring.

db:section.db:title: C++ API
db:section.db:para: Using a Qt module's C++ API requires linking against the module library, either directly or through other dependencies. Several build tools have dedicated support for this, including CMake and qmake.

db:section.db:title: Building with CMake
db:section.db:para: Use the find_package() command to locate the needed module component in the Qt6 package:
db:section.db:programlisting: find_package(Qt6 REQUIRED COMPONENTS Positioning) target_link_libraries(mytarget PRIVATE Qt6::Positioning)
db:section.db:para: For more details, see the Build with CMake overview.
